meanings.definition: Cover a piece of ground with concrete, asphalt, stones, etc.
meanings.sent1: The workers will pave the road with asphalt tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: It is common to pave driveways with concrete for durability.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken cross the newly paved road? To get to the other side!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed paved the way for her future success.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to pave the ground with golden light.

meanings.definition: Make a surface hard and smooth by laying down material.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew will pave the parking lot with fresh asphalt.
meanings.sent2: To pave the path, they used a roller to make the surface even.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to pave the table with a deck of cards, but they kept sliding off!
meanings.sent4: His kind words paved the rough conversation into a pleasant one.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to pave the canvas with vibrant colors.
